solution_line_template: If the price of an additional bear drops by fifty after the first purchase, the price of each additional bear is ${first_bear_price} - ${discount_per_bear} = $<<{first_bear_price}-{discount_per_bear}={additional_bear_price}>>{additional_bear_price}
Since Wally bought {total_bears} bears, he was charged fifty cents less on {total_bears}-1 = <<{total_bears}-1={additional_bears}>>{additional_bears} bears.
The total cost for the {additional_bears} bears is {additional_bears}*${additional_bear_price} = $<<{additional_bears}*{additional_bear_price}={total_additional_cost}>>{total_additional_cost}
For the {total_bears} bears, Wally paid a total of ${total_additional_cost}+${first_bear_price} = $<<{total_additional_cost}+{first_bear_price}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
